ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you ever had children in your household that you were fully or partially responsible for? This includes your own children, stepchildren, foster children or any other children that you cared for. This does not include short-term babysitting.

(ASK IF KIDS1 =1) Have any of your children ever been exposed to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana or another drug? Please don't include occasionally walking through a smoky place for a brief time.
(Mail survey only) When were your children exposed to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - In past 12 months
(Mail survey only) When were your children exposed to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - 1-5 years
(Mail survey only) When were your children exposed to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - 6-10 years
(Mail survey only) When were your children exposed to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - 11 plus years
What substance(s) were the child or children in your household exposed to? - Tobacco
What substance(s) were the child or children in your household exposed to? - Marijuana
What substance(s) were the child or children in your household exposed to? - Opioid pain pills like Vicodin or OxyContin
What substance(s) were the child or children in your household exposed to? - Fentanyl or heroin
What substance(s) were the child or children in your household exposed to? - Cocaine
What substance(s) were the child or children in your household exposed to? - Stimulants, methamphetamine, or speed
What substance(s) were the child or children in your household exposed to? - Some other drug
What substance(s) were the child or children in your household exposed to? - Don't know/not sure
What substance(s) were the child or children in your household exposed to? - No response
What substance(s) were the child or children in your household exposed to? - Text response
Who exposed your child or children to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - Parent
Who exposed your child or children to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - Step-parent, or spouse or partner of the child's parent

Who exposed your child or children to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - Child's guardian (a person with an ongoing legal responsibility for the care and protection of the child)
Who exposed your child or children to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - Sibling
Who exposed your child or children to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - Another relative
Who exposed your child or children to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - Family friend

Who exposed your child or children to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - Other person with whom the child comes into contact, such as a sports coach, teacher, or priest/religious leader
Who exposed your child or children to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - Someone else
Who exposed your child or children to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - No response
Who exposed your child or children to secondhand smoke from tobacco, marijuana, or another drug? - Text response
(Mail survey only) When were your children passengers in a car driven by someone who had been drinking or using drugs?  - In past 12 months
(Mail survey only) When were your children passengers in a car driven by someone who had been drinking or using drugs? - 1-5 years ago
(Mail survey only) When were your children passengers in a car driven by someone who had been drinking or using drugs? - 6-10 years ago
(Mail survey only) When were your children passengers in a car driven by someone who had been drinking or using drugs? - 11 plus years ago
(Mail survey only) Have any of your children ever been passengers in a car driven by someone who had been drinking or using drugs?
How many times, if any, were any of your children passengers in a car driven by someone who had been drinking or using drugs?
Notes: 1 = More than once; 2 = Once; 5 = Never; 888 = No response

Have you ever taken care of a child that was not your own child because of someone else's drinking or drug use? This could include caring for a grandchild, niece or nephew, as well as being a foster parent or adopting a child. Please don't include short-term babysitting.
(Mail survey only) When were your children negatively affected by someone's drinking or drug use? -  In past 12 months
(Mail survey only) When were your children negatively affected by someone's drinking or drug use? - 1-5 years ago
(Mail survey only) When were your children negatively affected by someone's drinking or drug use? - 6-10 years ago
(Mail survey only) When were your children negatively affected by someone's drinking or drug use? - 11 plus years ago

Have any of your children ever been negatively affected by someone's drinking or drug use? (By "negatively affected" we mean things like being left unsupervised, being yelled at or verbally abused, being physically hurt, witnessing serious violence or not having enough money because of someone else's alcohol or drug use.)
Whose drinking or drug use negatively affected the child/children? - Parent
Whose drinking or drug use negatively affected the child/children? - Step-parent, or spouse or partner of the child's parent
Whose drinking or drug use negatively affected the child/children? - Child's guardian (a person with an ongoing legal responsibility for the care and protection of the child)
Whose drinking or drug use negatively affected the child/children? - Sibling
Whose drinking or drug use negatively affected the child/children? - Another relative
Whose drinking or drug use negatively affected the child/children? - Family friend
Whose drinking or drug use negatively affected the child/children? - Other person with whom the child comes into contact, such as a sports coach, teacher, or priest/religious leader
Whose drinking or drug use negatively affected the child/children? - Someone else
Whose drinking or drug use negatively affected the child/children? - No response
Whose drinking or drug use negatively affected the child/children? - Text response
What substance(s) had the other person (for example, the child's parent or family member) been using? - Alcohol
What substance(s) had the other person (for example, the child's parent or family member) been using? - Marijuana

Did any of your children ever have to leave home to stay somewhere else because of someone in the household's drinking or drug use?
Have any of your children ever experienced emotional stress or been overly worried, stressed or concerned because of someone's drinking or drug use?
Have you ever limited or ended someone else's relationship with any of your children due to the person's drinking or drug use?
Was a child protection agency or family services ever called because of someone's drinking or drug use?
Has a parent/caregiver ever had their visitation or custody limited or terminated due to their alcohol or drug use (this could include incarceration/jail or involvement of child protective services)?
How many times was any of your children left in an unsupervised or unsafe situation because of someone's drinking or drug use?
Notes: 1 = More than once; 2 = Once; 5 = Never; 888 = No answer

ElementDescription: How many times was any of your children yelled at, criticized or otherwise verbally abused by someone who had been drinking or using drugs?
Notes: 1 = More than once; 2 = Once; 5 = Never; 888 = No answer

ElementDescription: How many times was any of your children physically hurt by someone who had been drinking or using drugs?
Notes: 1 = More than once; 2 = Once; 5 = Never; 888 = No answer

ElementDescription: How many times did any of your children witness serious violence in the home because of someone's drinking or drug use?
Notes: 1 = More than once; 2 = Once; 5 = Never; 888 = No answer

ElementDescription: How many times was there not enough money for the things needed by the children because of someone's drinking or drug use?
Notes: 1 = More than once; 2 = Once; 5 = Never; 888 = No answer
